articles.description:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky warned China against supporting Russia, saying doing so would bring on a world war. PHOTO: EPA-EFE   
Business Insider: If China allies with Russia there will be a new World War, Ukraine's President Zelenskyy warns 
* Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Monday that China allying with Russia would lead to another world war. 
* The Ukrainian president expressed his hope that China backs Ukraine over Russia in the ongoing war. 
* US officials have expressed concern that China could support Russia by providing lethal aid. 
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned China against supporting Russia, saying that doing so would threaten to bring about a new World War. 
The warning came in an interview published on Monday in the German newspaper Die Welt, in which Zelenskyy outlined his hopes that China would choose to support Ukraine, and not Russia, in the ongoing conflict. 
"At the moment, however, I don't think it's possible," he said, per Al Jazeera's translation of the interview.  Zelenskyy told the newspaper that he sees an opportunity for China to make a "pragmatic assessment" of the situation. 
Read more ....   
Update #1: Should China ally with Russia, there would be a world war: Zelensky (Reuters)  
Update #2: China backing Russia in Ukraine would mean World War III: Zelensky (NYPost)   
WNU Editor: I doubt Ukraien will be receptive to China's "peace plan" for the conflict .... China says it’s seeking role in Ukraine peace settlement (AP).
articles.title: Ukraine President Zelensky Warns China That Backing Russia In Ukraine Will Mean World War III

articles.description:
Chinese foreign minister Qin Gang has warned the west to stop “fuelling the fire” in Ukraine, Photograph: Thomas Peter/Reuters   
FOX News: China furious after US warns against arming Russia: ‘The US is in no position to tell China what to do’ 
Diplomatic relations between the U.S. and China deteriorated further on Monday after China’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs snapped at the Biden administration for suggesting that it has information suggesting that China is considering sending weapons and ammunition to Russia to help its war against Ukraine. 
Secretary of State Antony Blinken made that accusation Sunday on CBS, where he said Chinese companies have already been supplying Russia with non-lethal aid and may soon do more.  Read more ....   
WNU editor: China’s new foreign minister is accusing the US of shifting the blame for the Ukraine war on to China .... China foreign minister warns against ‘fuelling the fire’ over Ukraine conflict (The Guardian).

Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen meets US Congressman Ro Khanna, a member of the US House China Select Committee, and other members of the US delegation at the presidential office in Taipei, Taiwan, in this handout photo released on February 21, 2023. © Taiwan Presidential Office, Reuters 
France 24: Taiwan vows to deepen ties with US amid tensions with China 
Taiwan will boost military exchanges with the United States to curb "authoritarian expansionism", President Tsai Ing-wen said Tuesday after meeting with visiting US lawmakers. 
The five-day US Congressional visit comes after a top US defense official reportedly made a rare and highly secretive stopover to the self-ruled island as Washington-Beijing tensions flared over alleged Chinese spy balloons. 
"Taiwan and the United States continue to bolster military exchanges," Tsai said after convening with the US delegation at her office in Taipei.  "Going forward, Taiwan will cooperate even more actively with the United States and other democratic partners to confront such global challenges as authoritarian expansionism and climate change." 
Tsai did not provide further details on what the future exchanges might entail.   
Read more .... 
WNU Editor: China has responded .... Any separatist act of soliciting foreign support will only backfire, FM warns as Tsai vows to enhance military ties with US (Global Times).

RT: Russia suspends last nuclear treaty with US  
Russian President Vladimir Putin has announced the country’s temporary withdrawal from the New START Treaty  
Moscow is suspending its participation in the last remaining nuclear treaty between Russia and the US, President Vladimir Putin has announced. During his key address to the Russian parliament on Tuesday, he noted that Moscow will not exit the New START Treaty, but is temporarily withdrawing.   
Read more ....
